intro: Kadua kaalae, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironwood, is a shrub or small tree native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woody structure and dark green, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, red or orange berries. Kadua kaalae is adapted to coastal and dry environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. It plays an important role in the ecological systems of Hawaii, providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
